Description: Rounded arsenical copper axe-head: with two lugs and four drilled binding-holes. The blade has been cleaned of corrosion product and is in good condition, though the cutting edge and sides are eroded. The line of the original haft is visible on one face. There is no obvious sign of wear.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (46)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
